page.title: 08ECOLOGY
page.content: OUR DOMESDAY WALK Our route was a track from Stiperstones to Hope Valley passing through Hogstow, Lower Santley,Venus Bank to Fox Farm.We set off at 6.30 pm on a fine muggy evening 24July 1985.Our first find was a purple spotted orchid,found amongst the grass along a track at Lower Santley,also near a covered wall 50 yards from Lower Santley in a wet meadow we found Ragged Robin.Three Herons were roosting in dead Elms in the centre of the meadow a lovely sight.In all 100 species of wild flowers were recorded, together with musrooms and other fungi.The trees of the area include Beech,Field Maple,Oak,Sloe,Elder,Ash,Silver Birch and Mountain Ash.The track has a diversity of growing conditions for wild plants wet meadows to pasture land
